section.title: What is it
section.p: Author:Ken Webb. Created:13/12/06 5:25 PM. Title:Beard 2005 - Replication using MagicDraw and Xholon. Comment:This is a replication of the work reported in: Beard DA. (2005). A Biophysical Model of the Mitochondrial Respiratory System and Oxidative Phosphorylation, PLoS Computational Biology, 1(4): e36.
MMParams_Simulink: Simulink model Mitochondrial Model Parameter Values - PARAMETRES from Simulink model for Ken Webb
ExternalSpace: Beard, fig. 1. This is the Cytosol or Cytoplasm. Beard "external buffer". Beard "extra-mitochondrial buffer".
IntermembraneSpace: Beard, fig. 1. Beard, IM space.
Membrane: A membrane includes a lipid bilayer consisting of phospholipids, and also proteins. The lipids passively constrain the movement of objects across the membrane.
ATPsynthase: Beard, F1Fo ATPase. Hannaert/Guillaud model, ATP Synthase.
H: Beard, H+, proton, hydrogen ion.
KHAntiporter: Beard, transporter for hydrogen and potassium ions on the inner membrane.
MitochondrialCompartment: Beard, p. e36, "the model includes two mitochondrial compartments (matrix and intermembrane [IM] space)."
ATPf: Beard, fATP. Beard, the magnesium-unbound component of ATP in the IM space and the matrix.
ADPf: Beard, fADP. Beard, the magnesium-unbound component of ADP in the IM space and the matrix.
ATPm: Beard, mATP. Beard, the magnesium-bound component of ATP in the IM space and the matrix.
ADPm: Beard, mADP. Beard, the magnesium-bound component of ADP in the IM space and the matrix.
CytCRed: Beard, reduced form of cytochrome c.
CytCOx: Beard, oxidized form of cytochrome c.
RespiratoryComplex: Beard, respiratory chain complex. These are active objects.
